getSingleTimepoint(uint32,uint32,int24,u.details: Reverts if a timepoint at or before the desired timepoint timestamp does not exist. 0 may be passed as `secondsAgo' to return the current cumulative values. If called with a timestamp falling between two timepoints, returns the counterfactual accumulator values at exactly the timestamp between the two timepoints.

params.index: The index of the timepoint that was most recently written to the timepoints array
params.secondsAgo: The amount of time to look back, in seconds, at which point to return a timepoint

returns.tickCumulative: The cumulative tick since the pool was first initialized, as of `secondsAgo`
returns.volatilityCumulative: The cumulative volatility value since the pool was first initialized, as of `secondsAgo`

params.secondsAgos: Each amount of time to look back, in seconds, at which point to return a timepoint

returns.tickCumulatives: The cumulative tick since the pool was first initialized, as of each `secondsAgo`
returns.volatilityCumulatives: The cumulative volatility values since the pool was first initialized, as of each `secondsAgo`

params.time: The time of the dataStorage initialization, via block.timestamp truncated to uint32

prepayTimepointsStorageSlots(uint16,uint.details: Can be used to reduce the gas cost of future swaps

params.amount: of slots to fill, startIndex + amount must be <= type(uint16).max
params.startIndex: The start index, must be not initialized

timepoints(uint256).details: There is more convenient function to fetch a timepoint: getTimepoints(). Which requires not an index but seconds

params.index: The index of timepoint in the array

returns.initialized: Whether the timepoint has been initialized and the values are safe to use
returns.tickCumulative: The tick multiplied by seconds elapsed for the life of the pool as of the timepoint timestamp
returns.volatilityCumulative: Cumulative standard deviation for the life of the pool as of the timepoint timestamp
returns.windowStartIndex: Index of closest timepoint >= WINDOW seconds ago

write(uint16,uint32,int24).details: Writable at most once per block. Index represents the most recently written element. index must be tracked externally.

params.blockTimestamp: The timestamp of the new timepoint
params.index: The index of the timepoint that was most recently written to the timepoints array
params.tick: The active tick at the time of the new timepoint

returns.indexUpdated: The new index of the most recently written element in the dataStorage array
returns.newFee: The fee in hundredths of a bip, i.e. 1e-6

changeFeeConfiguration((uint16,uint16,ui.notice: Changes fee configuration for the pool

getTimepoints(uint32[]).notice: Returns the accumulator values as of each time seconds ago from the given time in the array of `secondsAgos`

initialize(uint32,int24).notice: Initialize the dataStorage array by writing the first slot. Called once for the lifecycle of the timepoints array

prepayTimepointsStorageSlots(uint16,uint.notice: Fills uninitialized timepoints with nonzero value

timepoints(uint256).notice: Returns data belonging to a certain timepoint

write(uint16,uint32,int24).notice: Writes a dataStorage timepoint to the array

documentation.text: @notice Changes fee configuration for the pool

@title The interface for the DataStorageOperator
 @dev This contract stores timepoints and calculates adaptive fee and statistical averages
